House Speaker Mike Johnson, R-La., said he’s been fielding calls from members concerned since the shooting, and has assured lawmakers that they are undertaking “a very thorough review of the existing options and how we might need to enhance that to ensure members’ security and safety.”

Threats to members of Congress were already on the rise before Kirk’s death. By the end of this calendar year, the U.S. Capitol Police said it is on track to work through 14,000 threat assessment cases involving members, up from 9,000 last year.

But Johnson also acknowledged there are limitations to protecting all 535 members of Congress, pointing out it would cost billions of dollars and thousands of additional police officers to provide a security detail for every member, which is just unrealistic.

“There are many security measures in place for members of Congress, at their homes, at their offices and when they go about. But we live in a dangerous society, and it’s difficult to cover even the president of the United States from every angle,” Johnson said. “The problem, ultimately, at the end of the day, is the human heart, that’s what we got to address.”

Kirk, 31, the co-founder of Turning Point USA who is credited with turning out the youth vote for Donald Trump’s successful comeback in 2024, was fatally shot by an assassin as he addressed a large crowd on the campus of Utah Valley University on Wednesday.
The gunman is still at large, though the FBI has released photos of a person of interest and said it had recovered the firearm used in the shooting.

“Unfortunately, violent rhetoric plus the wide availability of high-powered guns and guns of all kinds equals vicious political violence, and we can control both of those things, but we haven’t,” said one House Democrat who requested anonymity to discuss a sensitive matter. “And on the gun issue, it is going to require serious harm to somebody in a leadership position, or, God forbid, to a loved one, to get them to change.”

Kirk’s death comes two months after an assassin targeted Democratic lawmakers in Minnesota, killing former state House Speaker Melissa Hortman and her husband and wounding another lawmaker and his wife. That attack had already unnerved Capitol Hill, leading to a bipartisan push for enhanced security.

Following the Minnesota shootings, “we had the first all-senators security briefing that I can recall in 13 years here,” said Sen. Tim Kaine, D-Va., who added that he’ll keep doing events with his constituents but that the “minuses” to doing so “seem to be growing.”
At the time, the House sergeant at arms announced that members would be eligible to receive additional funding for residential security and personal security services.
But that money increase is set to expire at the end of the fiscal year later this month, and some members said leadership needs to do more to protect the rank-and-file members.

“We’ve got to re-evaluate what we’re doing. I think we better start taking it serious,” Rep. Tim Burchett, R-Tenn., said. “And our leadership is woefully ill-prepared. … They’re surrounded in their little protective bubble, and they look at us, and it’s been weeks after the last incident before we ever got anything.”

Some voices on social media are calling for retribution against the left, even though the identity or motive of the shooter is not yet known. And many Democrats are taking steps to better protect themselves. Rep. Jim Clyburn of South Carolina, a former top Democratic leader, said on MSNBC on Thursday that his staff has canceled events in Columbia and Charleston this weekend, though he didn’t cancel an upcoming event at a church.

One House Democrat from the Northeast told NBC News that she won’t hold any town halls or large public events because of security concerns. Instead, she holds private, invite-only events with constituents and stakeholders. The lawmaker, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to avoid being targeted, said her family is simply too important.
The U.S. Capitol Police, which fought off a politically motivated and violent mob on Jan. 6, 2021, said in a statement that it has “been operating in a heightened threat environment for a long time.”

“Our officers, agents and professional staff remain focused as they work around the clock,” the agency statement continued. “Although, for safety reasons, we cannot provide specific details about our increased security posture, we continue to work with our federal, state and local partners to carry out our critical mission.”

On Thursday morning during the House vote series, when members often walk outdoors from their offices to the Capitol, there was a noticeably stepped-up police presence outside the building. Security was already tight due to the 24th anniversary of the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001. But it’s also become more common in recent years for the police to shut down the plaza outside the Capitol during votes because of growing threats against members, as they did Thursday.
Some Republicans argued that members of Congress shouldn’t back down from holding events.

“You can’t give into the violence,” Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., said. “If we all retreat into our private spaces and close our doors and stay behind our locked doors and windows and gates, we need the opposite of that. We need to be able to come together even when we disagree.”

Rep. Thomas Massie, R-Ky., who has received death threats because of his many public clashes with Trump, most recently over his push to release the Epstein files, said lawmakers should take proper precautions but shouldn’t back down from individuals, or even presidents, who are trying to intimidate elected officials.
“I, already this summer, stepped up security because of death threats. Anytime you’re in the news, you just become a bigger target,” Massie told reporters.

“I think it’s meant to instill fear in people. I mean, if somebody just wanted Charlie Kirk to be gone, it would have been easier to meet him at the movie theater or a restaurant,” he said. “This, I think, was a statement by some deranged person, most likely, and we can’t let that person win.”
Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., grew emotional while speaking to reporters Thursday and echoed that sentiment.

“That’s what these folks try to do, they try to scare you into inaction,” he said. “And I think that that’s the last thing that Charlie would want, is for people to be quiet, whether you agree with him or not.”

title: Why Wanda Sykes Doesn’t Run Her Jokes By Her Kids and Wife
summary: Wanda Sykes shares why she does not run her jokes by her wife, Alex Sykes, and their two children.
story: Wanda Sykes says her wife, Alex Sykes, and their two children have learned to get used to being mentioned in her stand-up sets — whether they like it or not.

The comedian and actor appeared as a guest on the latest episode of the “Not Gonna Lie with Kylie Kelce” podcast and spoke about how she comes up with material for her jokes and comedy specials. Host Kylie Kelce said some of her favorite quips from Wanda Sykes are her jokes about raising 16-year-old twins Olivia and Lucas with Alex Sykes, whom the comic has been married to since 2008.
“Do you run your jokes by your kids before you perform them? Kelce asked Wanda Sykes.
She replied, “I do not.” While Kelce supported her answer, the comic revealed that her family doesn’t share the same enthusiasm.

“When (my children) were in middle school, they did say, ‘Um, hey, can you, like, not talk about us? Because our friends, you know, their parents let them see things that you do and then, you know, they joke on us.’”

She recalled telling her children, “‘Well, their parents shouldn’t let them watch things… my jokes are for mature (people).’” She explained her style of comedy and encouraged her children to watch her tamer jokes when she appears on shows like “Late Night.”
But they pushed back and requested, again, to not be mentioned in her jokes. She responded with a blunt retort.
“I’m like, ‘Um, well, you want a car, right? Mama’s got to buy that car,’” she said.
As for her wife, Wanda Sykes also revealed that she doesn’t get a heads-up about being the butt of a joke either. However, that doesn’t stop Alex Sykes from voicing her disapproval after.
“She’ll come to the show and she will let me know if it’s too hard on her or whatever,” Wanda Sykes added.
She then joked, “And I say, ‘Don’t you want a place in France?... How’s mama going to buy that place in France?’”

“The Upshaws” star did clarify that her impersonation of her wife during her shows isn’t exactly accurate. When Kelce mentioned that Wanda Sykes often acts out on stage that her wife is a heavy smoker, the comedian confirmed that Alex Sykes does not smoke.
“It’s the air of a French woman,” Wanda Sykes said about her spouse, who was born in France. “She does not smoke, but that’s just how I see her.”
Alex Sykes doesn’t seem to be too bothered by the character her wife has created.
In 2023, she posted a selfie of her pretending to smoke to Instagram and wrote, “Caught in the act!” with a laughing emoji to celebrate the release of the comic’s Netflix special.
She added, “I don’t actually smoke, but I couldn’t resist this photo op!” along with multiple hashtags, including “comedywife.”

title: 'The Office' vs 'The Paper': How the 2 Shows Compare
summary: What are the differences and similarities between “The Office” and "The Paper"? How are the two shows connected?
story: “The Office” has become one of the most popular mockumentary style sitcoms in pop culture history.

The American version premiered in 2005 and is based on the 2001 British series co-created by and starring Ricky Gervais. Adapted for NBC by Greg Daniels, the comedy follows an eccentric and intrusive boss Michael Scott, portrayed by Steve Carell.
The single-camera and interview style show became a hit, running for nine seasons before it concluded in 2013. It also won five Emmy Awards, including outstanding comedy series.

Now, over a decade later, Daniels, along with Michael Koman (“Nathan For You”), has returned with “The Paper,” a spinoff that is set in the same universe but takes on a whole new crew of quirky characters — and one familiar face.
Oscar Nuñez returns as the former Dunder Mifflin accountant Oscar Martinez, now at a new company in Toledo, Ohio.
Domhnall Gleeson takes on the role of new head boss, Toledo Truth Teller newspaper editor-in-chief Ned Sampson. During a Sept. 3 appearance on TODAY, the actor noted that “The Paper” is not a remake.

“It’s the same documentary crew as ‘The Office’ and they followed what happened at Dunder Mifflin and they end up in Toledo. Oscar is still working, but he’s working for a local newspaper,” he said. “There’s a new boss.”
Read on to learn more about the difference between “The Office” and “The Paper.”
The Premise

"The Office" is set in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and follows boss Michael Scott and the Dunder Mifflin staff as they navigate deadlines, egos, different personalities and inappropriate behavior during their work days at the paper company. As the years went by, viewers got to see office romances start, fizzle and more.

The 10-episode Peacock series takes viewers to Toledo, Ohio, as Ned takes over a dying historic newspaper. Filled with ambition to revive it to its glory days, he is met with opposing figures, reporters with no experience and people willing to try new things — all while the cameras capture the process.
The Companies

The fictional company for “The Office” is Dunder Mifflin. It is a paper sales company with branches all over the country, but the show focuses on the Scranton branch. The mid-size supplier sells paper and office supplies.
The fate of Dunder Mifflin is spoken about in the first episode of “The Paper.”
A new company, One and Done Laser, took over the office space after Dunder Mifflin was purchased by Enervate in Toledo in 2019. This leads to the company that is now highlighted in “The Paper.”

The company Enervate sells products made out of paper, which makes sense why it purchased Dunder Mifflin. It sells office supplies like janitorial paper, toilet tissue and seat protectors. Additionally, it also sells local newspapers, including the Toledo Truth Teller, the new setting for the show.
The Office Setting

Dunder Mifflin was located in Scranton, Pennsylvania, at the Scranton Business Park. Other businesses included in the square included Vance Refrigeration, Ruben’s Electrical Contractors and Kavala Data Filters.
Dunder Mifflin had a beige, regular office setting with a reception desk, multiple wooden desks and offices for boss Michael Scott and conference rooms.
The headquarters for Enervate and the Toledo Truth Teller is the Truth Teller Tower in Toledo, Ohio. Also in that space is Softies toilet paper brand.
Inside, cubicles are placed all across the floor with the Softies team to one side and The Toledo Truther Teller's skeletal crew on the other.
The Cast
Led by Steve Carell, "The Office" had over a dozen stars that brought to life characters that are now cemented in pop culture and comedy history.

Among the original cast members were Rainn Wilson as Dwight Schrute, John Krasinski as Jim Halpert, Jenna Fischer as Pam Beesly, Mindy Kaling as Kelly Kapoor, B.J. Novak as Ryan Howard, Leslie David Baker as Stanley Hudson, Brian Baumgartner as Kevin Malone, Angela Kinsey as Angela Martin, Phyllis Smith as Phyllis Lapin, Craig Robinson as Darryl Philbin and Oscar Nuñez as Oscar Martinez among many others.
With over 200 episodes, there were a slew of guest stars and new additions to the cast as some members left the show.
“The Paper” sees Oscar’s return as the company’s accountant. He also gets the opportunity to contribute to the newspaper.

Then there's newspaper managing editor Esmeralda Grand, portrayed by Sabrina Impacciatore, who gives Ned a run for his money. Additional reporters and members of the Toledo Truth Teller include Duane Shepard Sr. as Barry, Chelsea Frei as Mare, Ramona Young as Nicole, Melvin Gregg as Detrick, Gbemisola Ikumelo as Adelola, Alex Edelman as Adam, Eric Rahill as Travis and Tim Key as Enervate corporate strategist Ken.
(Peacock, Universal Television and TODAY share the same parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: Chloe Fineman Calls 'SNL' Cast Changes 'Shocking'
summary: Chloe Fineman isn’t hiding her shock over the recent cast shakeups at “Saturday Night Live" ahead of the Season 51 premiere
story: Chloe Fineman isn’t hiding her shock over the recent cast shakeups at “Saturday Night Live" ahead of the Season 51 premiere.

The 37-year-old cast member and beloved celebrity impressionist told Extra TV that she was still wrapping her head around the new changes, which include the departures of Heidi Gardner, Michael Longfellow, Devon Walker, Emil Wakim and Please Don't Destroy comedy troupe member John Higgins.
“Pretty wild,” Fineman said of the cast shuffles. “Some shocking stuff. A little heartbreak, sadness. I haven’t fully processed anything, but I will say the show has such a turnover.”

The cast changes also include some new talent on the "SNL" roster. Ben Marshall, another member of Please Don’t Destroy, will be bumped up to featured player in the legendary sketch comedy show's upcoming season, which premieres Oct. 4.
Four other newcomers — Tommy Brennan, Jeremy Culhane, Kam Patterson and Veronika Slowikowska —  have also joined the cast, "SNL" announced earlier this month.

Veteran cast members Fineman, Kenan Thompson, Bowen Yang, Ego Nwodim, Marcello Hernández, Mikey Day, Sarah Sherman, James Austin Johnson, Andrew Dismukes, Colin Jost, Michael Che, Ashley Padilla and Jane Wickline will return for Season 51, per Variety.
Fineman, who's going into her seventh season at "SNL," said she was "excited" about working with the incoming new talent.
“It’s so many people,” she said. "When I saw how young the new cast was I immediately got a laser."

As for what impressions she may debut this season, Fineman said  a lot of fans have begged her, "Do the mom with the thousand texts on Netflix,” seemingly referring to Kendra Licari, the real-life mother who spent time in prison for cyberbullying her daughter. The story is told in the new Netflix docuseries "Unknown Number: The High School Catfish."
“I’m sure I’ll do that," Fineman said before adding that pop culture news happens so quickly, she'll need to wait before coming up with other new ideas.
"By the time we go back in like a month, what’s relevant right now will completely change,” she said.

title: Jason Alexander Shares Poignant Key to Success in His 43-Year Marriage
summary: Jason Alexander spoke in a Sprouht interview about the keys to his successful marriage with wife Daena Title.
story: Jason Alexander knows a thing or two about marriage.
The “Seinfeld” star, 65, who has been married to Daena Title since he was 22, says there are a few factors that contribute to a successful union.
“A piece of it is dumb luck. She walked in the door. I went, ‘Oh my God.’ She went, ‘Eh,’” he recently joked while appearing in an interview with social media star William Rossy of Sprouht.
“The opportunity to meet someone that kind of really does line up spiritually with you, it’s dumb luck,” he continued.

Alexander, of course, gained fame playing George Costanza on “Seinfeld,” a character who constantly had problems with women he dated. In real life, the eight-time Emmy nominee said he and his wife have changed, while noting they were always “headed in the same direction.”

“Our values didn’t change. Our interests didn’t change. We didn’t suddenly become different kinds of people because of the way life had worked or not worked for us,” he said. “We took the work of it seriously. When we had trouble, we went to therapy or she went on her own. I went on (my) own. We went together. We tried to figure it out.”
Alexander then cited something he read for the first time in the play “A Raisin in the Sun” when he was 12 years old.

“When do you think is the time to love someone the most? When they’ve done good and made things easy for everybody?” he said. “It’s when they’re at their lowest and they can’t believe in themselves anymore because the world’s whipped them so.”
Alexander also said his wife knows the potential he has, even when he may not reach it.

“What I say about my wife is on my worst day, when I am the worst version of myself that I can be, she is able to know who I am on my best day. And she beckons me back,” he said, echoing a comment he made during an appearance on TODAY back in March. “And that’s extraordinary.”
He said there’s a satisfaction in being with someone he knows so well for so long.
“It is the most comforting thing in the world that I have taken this journey with someone who’s known me almost the whole way. There’s just a joy in it,” he said.
As for how people struggle to maintain relationships, Alexander said it’s important not to give up.

“If you want it to work, you can make it work,” he said. “And I know so many guys — guys in particular -- who walk away thinking, ‘It’s the problem.’ And then they go out and start a new relationship and they go, ‘I have the same problem.’ ... If the problem is within you, it’s going to go wherever you go.”
He was then asked to define love.

“In a cup that deep,” he said, motioning a glass, “it’s three-quarters filled with selflessness. It is literally elevating someone else’s concerns, needs, passions, existence to being a little more important than your own. That’s all it is.”

title: Who Is Walton Goggins’ Wife? All About Nadia Conners
summary: Who is Walton Goggins' wife, Nadia Conners? She is his second wife. What happened to his first wife? Who is his son? Find out.
story: Walton Goggins is known for his notable onscreen work alongside co-stars, like Timothy Olyphant (“Justified”), Danny McBride (“The Righteous Gemstones”) and Leslie Bibb (“The White Lotus”).
However, offscreen, the thrice Emmy-nominated actor shares his best chemistry with Nadia Conners, his wife of the past 14 years.
The 53-year-old actor has referred to Conners as his “best friend,” the “Bonnie to (his) Clyde” and “the brightest candle on any cake."

Conners is Goggins' second wife. The actor married his first wife, Leanne Knight, in 2001, and she died in 2004. Goggins opened up about the grief following her death in an interview with GQ, and how it led him to travel the world — including to Thailand, where his season of "The White Lotus" filmed.

“I think I haven’t had the time to fully unpack the symmetry between those two people showing up at the same place, separated by 20 years. And a wife and a kid and peace and all the rest of it,” he told the publication.
Read on to learn more about Goggins’ other half.
Like Goggins, She Works in Entertainment

The filmmaker has several writing and directing credits to her name, including the 2007 environmental documentary “The 11th Hour,” which she made with her sister Leila Conners Petersen and Leonardo DiCaprio, and the 2024 dramedy “The Uninvited,” in which Goggins plays a leading role.
Their 1st Date Was a Setup — in Secret
As for how the couple got together, it was a setup.
A “very, very close friend” of Goggins secretly arranged for Conners to meet the star at a fundraiser dinner for a film he was working on.
“Our first date, I guess it was kind of awkward, you know?” he recalled during a 2019 visit to “The Talk.”

The awkward part was that he didn’t know it was a date at all. He was supposed to be schmoozing with people at the dinner party to help raise money, but when Conners sat down next to him, he was captivated by her company. In other words, fundraising was the furthest thing from his mind.
“I didn’t talk to anyone there that I was supposed to talk to,” he continued. “At the end of it, she said, ‘You’re going to take me home, right?’ And I said, ‘Uh, yes!’”

That was the beginning of their romance, one that Goggins believed was random happenstance. It wasn’t until months later that Conners clued him in that their meeting that night was, in fact, a blind date.
The Couple Married in 2011
After six years of dating, Conners and Goggins made their partnership official with a wedding in 2011.
The two swapped vows in a small ceremony held in their backyard, Goggins shared in an Instagram post.
She and Goggins Have a Son
Conners and Goggins' son, Augustus, was born in January 2011, the same year the couple married.
As a proud mom, Conners frequently shares photos of Augustus on social media and raves about her “shooting star.”

To mark his first day of eighth grade, in 2024, she wrote, “We are so proud of you Augustus!! You have become an extraordinary person, a deep feeling human, and already a scintillating intellectual!! We love you. There is nothing like watching you walk into school… backpack on and ready for the year ahead.”
Conners Married Goggins Again in 2019
Goggins and Conners both have November birthdays, and when the pair celebrated their big days in 2019, they decided to make the occasion even bigger.
Rather than just saying “happy birthday” to each other, they said “I do” all over again, too.
“.... my wife and I were married almost 9 years ago with 5 people and our 6 month old in attendance in our backyard,” Goggins wrote in a social media post that included photos from the 2019 event.

“We never had a party. With a newborn we were too tired. But this past Saturday night we had a joint birthday party and the surprise was... we did it again! Only this time our son was almost 9 and we were surrounded by friends and family who had no idea what was about to go down. The joy in that room... all the time that has passed, the ups and downs the hills and valleys only to find ourselves walking in this verdant pasture, with each other and all these people that we have in our lives was worth every step.”
Goggins signed off the post by adding, “Life is long, it is short, it can at times be bitter but... when you really step back It (sic) is just so so damn sweet.”
Goggins Calls Her His 'Sun'
For Mother’s Day 2024, Goggins took to Instagram to celebrate Conners. In a sweet post, he noted the many things that she is to both him and to their son.

“The Mother that you are, the Wife, the Friend, the Soulmate, the Human, the ARTIST that you are… I’ve seen you navigate this river of life with such grace and humility, vulnerability and dignity… with Humor! You are our SUN. Our love for you is immeasurable. Happy Mother’s Day my love.”
She is equally effusive about her husband, as evidenced by her birthday post for his 50th birthday.

"Walton, it’s FINALLY your 50th birthday. YOU are the life of every party but behind that charisma, humor and energy, you are the man who prepares and that takes nothing for granted; not a role, a moment, a friend, or an encounter. You inspire me endlessly by watching you spin daily life into gold. I am so damn lucky to be your partner, to watch you grow as you evolve through every high and low. I couldn’t love you more my best friend and husband and father to Augustus," she wrote.

title: Adam Scott's Wife: All About His Relationship with Naomi Scott
summary: Adam and Naomi Scott have been married over 25 years. Here's everything to know about their relationship, kids and more.
story: If you’re looking for a real Hollywood love story, look no further than Adam and Naomi Scott, nee Sablan.

Adam Scott rose to fame as Ben Wyatt in the comedy “Parks and Recreation,” and is now an awards show darling for starring in and producing the sci-fi thriller “Severance.” He's up for two Emmys this year, both for his acting and producing on the show.

Naomi Scott, meanwhile, is a force behind the camera. The producer started her career working on “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” during its inaugural year in 2003, starting as an assistant before working her way up to producer, she told SAGIndie, and now runs a production company with her husband.
This powerhouse couple has been going strong for over 25 years, and the “Severance” actor has never been shy about expressing his devotion to his wife.
In a birthday tribute on Instagram, he described her as “my partner in life and work.”
“I love her so much I’ll disintegrate into a fine powder if I try and explain,” he continued.
1998: Adam and Naomi First Meet at a Bar
Adam Scott and Naomi Sablan’s meet-cute unfolded at a bar on Sunset Boulevard in 1998, though it didn’t exactly go according to script.
In a 2015 interview with Vulture, Adam Scott said his future wife “abruptly” left the bar when they first met. Her reason? He was an actor, which was apparently a red flag at the time.
Despite that less-than-promising first encounter, the pair began dating that same year and married in 2005.

Adam loves to talk about his love. In 2022, he gushed to Us Weekly about his wife, saying,“I just love (Naomi). I think she’s the coolest, the smartest, the funniest and the most beautiful. It’s pretty simple.”
2006 and 2008: The Couple Welcomes their Kids
The couple has two kids. Adam and Naomi Scott welcomed a son, Graham in 2006. Their daughter, Francesca (who goes by Frankie), was born in 2008.

This past Mother’s Day, Adam posted a sweet ode to his wife again on his Instagram, writing: “Being an incredible mom is just one of so many things that make Naomi the beautiful, brilliant, impressive person she is — that being said, holy shit she’s an unbelievable mom — it’s insane. HAPPY MOTHER’S DAY to the person who keeps our world on its axis…”
2012: They Launch a Production Company
After their kids were born, Naomi Scott took time off work, she told SAGIndie.

“I was heading back to work when I realized that the hours I was going to be working on someone else’s show were going to be so great that I was going to not see not only my child but also my husband,” she said.
Rather than compromise on family time, the couple came up with an ingenious solution: co-found their own production company.
“We took the chance and started a company and really came up with our first series idea, which we did for Adult Swim, called ‘The Greatest Event in Television History,’” Naomi explained.
Their production company Gettin’ Rad Productions was founded in 2012, producing the TV show “Ghosted” and the movie “Fun Mom Dinner,” among others.

title: Taylor Frankie Paul's Dating History: Inside the New 'Bachelorette's' Past Love Life
summary: Who are Taylor Frankie Paul's boyfriends and husband? About Dakota Mortensen, Tate Paul and the soft swinging scandal.
story: Taylor Frankie Paul is taking a new approach to finding love in her star turn as “The Bachelorette.”
She’s no stranger to having her love life recorded on reality TV. Paul’s tumultuous former relationship played out in the first two seasons of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives.”

And she’s definitely used to the camera. Paul gained a following on #MomTok, the corner of TikTok where Mormon moms from Utah posted about their lives (and did dances). Then came controversy. Paul and her ex-husband were involved in what is now called a “soft swinging scandal.”

But “The Bachelorette” is a change of pace. Speaking to Alex Cooper on the “Call Her Daddy” podcast, where she first announced the news of her casting, the mom of three said her life set-up made her hesitate about becoming “Bachelorette.”

“I’m like, ‘OK, how do I make this work? I’m a co-parent.’ I have two baby daddies, not one, so I’m dealing with two different people, right? My children, my home base is here. Can I travel that long?”
Here’s what to know about her past relationships.
Tate Paul
Paul married her ex-husband, Tate Paul in 2016, per People. The former couple has two children together: an 8-year-old daughter named Indy and a 5-year-old son named Ocean.

The duo was involved in a “soft swinging” scandal that made headlines in 2022. The form of consensual non-monogamy occurs when a couple becomes intimate with other couples. Paul previously described soft swinging as “when you just hook up but you don’t go all the way” in a TikTok Live, which is no longer on her TikTok page but is available online.
While participating in soft swinging, Paul said she “messed up” and broke the boundaries she and her husband had set.

“The agreement was just like, as long as we were both there and we saw it and we knew it, it was OK,” she said in the May 2022 TikTok Live video. “And the second it goes behind without each other, you’ve stepped out of the agreement. And I did that.”
In the video, Paul detailed the decision to separate from her husband.

“For Tate and I, I think it’s best that we separate and divorce, and kind of find ourselves and find what makes us happy, start fresh,” she said. “I think there’s been a lot of evil around us and we’ve participated in, obviously… And I think we need a fresh start and to kind of wake up. This was a good wake up call for us and our entire friend group.”
Dakota Mortensen
When Paul introduced her followers to Dakota Mortensen in 2022, she described him as the man she “cheated with” during the soft swinging scandal.
During their relationship, Paul and Mortensen experienced an ectopic pregnancy. They later conceived their son Ever, who was born in 2024.
The former couple had a rocky relationship, which was chronicled on “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives.”

In 2023, Paul was arrested on charges including assault and committing domestic violence in the presence of a child. The reality star went on to reach a plea deal in her assault case and pled guilty to aggravated assault. The other charges against her were dismissed, according to court documents viewed by The Salt Lake Tribune.

Hulu viewers saw Paul and Mortensen navigate life as new parents in Season 1 of “The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives.” Following the first season, Paul spoke with TODAY.com and said she and Mortensen were taking steps to strengthen their relationship, including couples therapy.
Flash forward to Season 2 and Paul struggled to trust Mortensen after she learned that he had been involved with another woman at the beginning of their relationship.
Mortensen admitted to lying in a confessional interview, saying, “I was always doing it selfishly to protect myself. I just wish I was honest with her but it’s too late.”
Viewers learned that the couple had broken up and wondered if there was a possibility of a future reunion. Paul addressed the topic in an interview with People before the Season 2 premiere.

“I feel like right now we are individually working on ourselves and trying to heal, for not only ourselves, but for our son. So that’s been the main focus the last few months, last half of a year,” she said.
While appearing on the Season 2 reunion special, the couple admitted they still had feelings for each other despite their issues.
When she appeared on the “Call Her Daddy” podcast, Paul said she was ready to move on from Mortensen and revealed that she broke things off.
“Did I love him? Absolutely. I had a baby with him. I wanted to be with him, but it just did not work out,” she said.
Paul also said that she hadn't told Mortensen that she was going to be the next Bachelorette.
“I have not confirmed it with him. So I don’t know if he knows or if he knew I had the opportunity,” she said, adding that he would likely be “sad” to hear the news. “So he’ll know Wednesday.”
Paul Has Started Dating Again Since Her Breakup with Mortensen
During her interview with Cooper on “Call Her Daddy,” Paul said she has dipped her toes into the dating pool since breaking up with Mortensen.

“He does know that I was dating and and you know, meeting people. So we’ve already had that first hurt, I guess. I think that’s the hardest part is (when) you see their first dating or hookup or whatever it is. That’s going to always like take a toll no matter what,” the 31-year-old said.

Paul recently posted some photos with a mystery man holding a guitar, prompting her followers to wonder if she was in a new relationship. Cooper asked the reality star about the man during the podcast and she offered the following response.

“I do curveballs all the freaking time of being like, ‘What? Huh?’ And I know that’s people’s reaction. That’s the freaking point. And it wasn’t a soft launch, whatever. I’ve met the guy twice. And so it was funny,” she said.
What She's Looking for in a Man

Looking ahead to her journey on “The Bachelorette,” Paul shared a bit about her ideal man while speaking with Cooper. For starters, she’d prefer someone in their 30s or early 40s, but is open to someone as young as 27 or 28.
Finding someone who’s willing to relocate to Utah, where she lives, is also a priority.
“I am in Utah and I have two baby daddies. I’m going nowhere, so you will be moving to me in Utah, so if you like me enough, you will be moving,” she said.
A man’s career “doesn’t matter” to Paul, but she wants someone who is “hardworking” and “motivated.”
While she’s open to Mormon men, Paul made it clear that her future mate doesn’t have to be affiliated with any particular religion.
“I don’t really care what religion you are. How do you treat other people? That is what I look at,” she said.

title: 2 Women Receive Bob Haircuts Live on TODAY: See Before-And-After Photos
summary: Celebrity hair stylist Chris McMillan gave two TODAY fans a special hair makeover on the show. See the before and after photos!
story: Celebrity hair stylist Chris McMillan gave two fans a special hair makeover on TODAY.
McMillan, who famously gave Jenna Bush Hager a bob hairstyle on TODAY, came back on the show on Sept. 11, to give two viewers, Ally and Marisol, the same look.
Ally, 30, a newlywed from Astoria, N.Y., said she grew her hair out for her wedding but now wants to cut it shorter since her nuptials are over.
"I'm ready for a whole new look," she said in a clip that aired on the program.

"To me, the bob just gives absolute power and exudes confidence and I think it's so perfect for this next big chapter in my life," she said. "We're going on our honeymoon next month and I can't think of a better hairstyle."
Ally then shocked her husband, Adam, when she walked out in Studio 1A with her new bob hairstyle.
"I love it so much," Adam said while glancing at his wife.
Ally said she loved the look, too.
"Amazing! So chic! You're a miracle worker," she told McMillan, who then explained how he gave her the look.
"Ally was perfect. I gave her a blunt CLB, cute little bob, and I gave her a flick. I kept it really blunt, followed her jawline, not an A-line and gave her that sort of a flick," he said.
"That's some hot newlywed hair," Jenna added.
Next, Marisol, 43, a mom of three from Chico, California, said she wanted to get a bob because she's ready for a "fresh new haircut."

As a busy parent, she said she stopped going to the hair salon five years ago and now gives herself haircuts at home. However, since she's a baker, she said she needs a style that's easy to wear daily — and that's when she thought about Jenna's bob.

"When I saw Jenna cut her hair on live TV, I thought — just go for it," she said in a video clip. "In this new exciting chapter of my life, I would love a chic new hairstyle that would go more with what I'm doing now. I can't wait to take this leap. Thank you!"
Like Ally, Marisol then entered Studio 1A to show off her new look, and she said the hairstyle made her feel "lighter."
"I feel amazing," she said, while looking at her husband, who called her "beautiful."
McMillan then explained how he gave Marisol her new look, which he calls a sha-bob, also known as a shaggy bob.

"Marisol has really, really thick hair, really curly and a deep side part. So I was like, let's just give her a part in the middle Let's start there and I gave her a sha-bob, which is a shaggy bob. Because her hair is so thick, I added in some layers," he said.
In June, McMillan trimmed Jenna’s long tresses into a bob on TODAY.
Jenna loved the look so much that she called McMillan a "genius" and referred him to fans.
“If anyone has a chance to get your hair cut by him, go ahead and do it,” she said.
McMillan explained that he loves a good bob, especially when the person has a "really thick head of hair" like Jenna.
“You can slick it behind your ears, like do the tuck,” he said, while showing how a bob can be styled in different ways.
“You can wear it natural, you can wear it wavy,” he added.

title: All About Keri Russell and Matthew Rhys' Relationship
summary: Keri Russell and Matthew Rhys share a son together but are they married? They are still together. Here's what to know about their relationship.
story: On screen, Keri Russell and Matthew Rhys paired a pair of married Russian spies living undercover in “The Americans,” which ran from 2013 to 2018 on FX.
Off screen, the "Felicity" star and the Welsh actor were falling in love.

While “The Americans” was still airing in 2017, the couple spoke to People about making their relationship work. Russell said a bit of “alone time,” since they spend so much time together. Plus, Rhys said, “she has the patience of a saint, so that helps."
Rhys and Russell are expected to attend the 2025 Emmys together. This year, Russell has been nominated for outstanding lead actress in a drama series for her work in “The Diplomat.”
They Met Long Before 'The Americans'
During a joint appearance on “Watch What Happens Live" in 2017, Rhys and Russell recalled the first time they met.
Rhys said it was a “a very long, long time ago” — back when he was 26 years old.
“I very drunkenly asked her for her number when she was a young single slip of a thing,” Rhys said.
They had met after a "kickball party," Russell said. The conversation happened in a parking lot after Russell asked Rhys to open up a beer for her.
Rhys gave more of the story in a 2023 appearance on “Watch What Happens Live." He left her a drunken voice mail — to which she didn't respond.
Their Romance Rekindled on 'The Americans'
But "it took a while," Rhys said of their love story on “Watch What Happens Live."
Russell said that one day, after a "heavy dose of fight training," Rhys told her, "We've met before."
She responded, "No, we haven't." Rhys then reminded her about the "drunken message" he left her. "As soon as he said that, I knew exactly what he meant," she said.
Russell said in a later interview with Variety in 2024 that they fell in love shooting the first season.
“I was in love with Matthew,” Russell said. “We were, like, hot and heavy in love, shooting the spy stuff at night in disguises and wigs. I mean, it was such a fun, sexy time. So fun, oh my gosh.”
They Kept Their Romance a Secret On Set
Rhys told Andy Cohen in a 2023 appearance on "Watch What Happens Live" that he and Russell kept their relationship private on set for "about a year."
Rhys told People how they broke the news to their producers — not only that they were dating, but that they were expecting a baby. Their son, Sam, was born between Seasons 4 and 5.

“So when we told our producers like, ‘Oh, we do have something to say,’ they’re like, ‘Oh, don’t tell us you’re together.’ We’re like, ‘Actually, we’re going to have a baby.’ They were like, ‘Oh my God,’ because we’d kept it a secret for so long.”
Their Son, Sam, Was Born in 2016
Rhys and Russell welcomed their son, Sam, into the world in 2016. That year, Russell raved about their kid in an interview with TODAY. She said, "He’s so good. He’s big and fat and nice.”
Russell is also mom to two kids, River and Willa, from her marriage to her ex-husband, carpenter Shane Deary.
They're Not Married — But Matthew Rhys Joked About Proposing in an Acceptance Speech

At the 2018 Emmys, Rhys won the award for outstanding lead actor in a drama series for his role in "The Americans." When he was announced as the winner, the actor gave Russell a big kiss on before making his way to the stage.
Near the end of his acceptance speech, he peered out into the audience and thanked Russell.

“And finally, to the woman who truly got me this award, who just stands in front of me every day and just puts up with me. She said, 'If you propose to me, I would punch you clean in the mouth.' I don’t have the words or the time, neither which would do you justice, Keri Lynn, except thank you, more to come, thank you."
They Were Both Nominated Multiple Times for 'The Americans'
Keri Russell was up for an Emmy in 2016, 2017 and 2018 for "The Americans." Rhys was nominated the same years but won in 2018.
When they were both up for Golden Globes for "The Americans" in 2019, the couple joked about their coordinated awards in an interview with with Ryan Seacrest for E! News.
“Thank God we don’t have to break up,” Russell joked.
They Recently Reunited on Screen for 'Cocaine Bear'
In 2018, "The Americans" aired its final episode. They reunited on screen for the 2023 flick "Cocaine Bear."

“I unashamedly jumped on my partner’s coattails because I knew (Keri Russell) was doing this movie with (director) Elizabeth Banks, who we know, and I read the script and I simply said, ‘Who’s playing that? That little fun part, a few seconds in the beginning?’ She goes, ‘I don’t know.’ I said, ‘Ask Banks.’ And then she said, ‘No, it’s been cast,’ and I said ‘Tell Banks I’ll do it.’ And then I was like, ‘Well actually, just ask her if I can do it,'” Rhys told The A.V. Club.
Rhys Supports Russell in Her 'Diplomat' Era
Rhys and Russell walked the red carpet together at the 2024 Golden Globes. That year, Russell was nominated for an Emmy for the Netflix drama "The Diplomat." She's up for an award again this year.
In an interview with Variety about her work in "The Diplomat," Rhys gave an assessment of his partner's personality.

"She is naturally a very shy person, and to expose herself in that way day after day, I think she finds both taxing and challenging. But she is a mind, and she loves being challenged, and she loves words — books are her biggest passion. Words and narrative are her great love.”

title: Jay Shetty Shares With Sheinelle Jones What He’s Learned About Grief
summary: Jay Shetty shared with Sheinelle Jones on TODAY what he's learned about grief after she told him his podcast helped her through her "darkest days" while her husband, Uche Ojeh, was fighting brain cancer.
story: Podcaster and author Jay Shetty shared a poignant way for Sheinelle Jones to look at her grief after she thanked him on TODAY for his comforting words when her husband was fighting brain cancer.

Sheinelle shared that his "On Purpose" podcast became a lifeline during the most difficult time in her life. After thanking Shetty in person on TODAY Sept. 11, she asked him if he has any insight into what she can do with her grief.
Her husband, Uche Ojeh, died at 45 in May after having been treated for an aggressive form of brain cancer called glioblastoma.
"First of all, thank you for sharing your story, I can’t imagine how much courage that requires," Shetty told Sheinelle. "I know that’s helping so many people right now."

"I think one of my favorite things I’ve learned is actually from a poet and a writer named Jessica Watson," he continued. "And she shared this beautiful story that how grief is like holding a stone in your pocket. And it feels like it’s always there, it’s rubbing against things, you feel it when you put your hand in your pocket."

"And over time, we’re told that that goes away, but it doesn’t, it actually always stays there," he said. "But she says as we get stronger, that stone gets lighter. And that’s what we’re looking for is that resilience growth."
Sheinelle shared that she listened to Shetty's podcast while her husband of 17 years was fighting cancer.

"When I was really fighting to keep my head above water during my husband's cancer battle, I promised myself that if I ever had the opportunity to thank anyone who helped me through my darkest days, I would," Sheinelle told him. "I would listen to Jay and his podcast and meditations a lot."
Shetty, 38, also talked about a previous conversation he had former President Joe Biden in 2023 during an episode about grief. Biden's first wife and baby daughter were killed in a car crash in 1972.

"He talked about how family showed up for him when he needed it most," Shetty said on TODAY. "He said he had an overwhelming advantage because his family stood by his side. And so for those who are in your life and the lives of others who have lost someone, show up."
"You don't have to have the right things to say, you don't have to know how to do the right thing, just show up and be present."
Sheinelle returned to TODAY on Sept. 5 after having been on leave since Ojeh's death. Her first full week back began on Sept. 8.
She spoke with Savannah Guthrie in an emotional interview that aired on TODAY Sept. 5 about how she is processing the loss of the father of their three children.

“I found beauty in the nightmare,” she said. “And trust me, it is a nightmare to watch a 45-year-old do two triathlons and live and breathe off of soccer and his kids ... to take a guy like that and watch him have to deal with this fight was a nightmare.”

title: What Is Spotify Lossless Listening? New Music Feature, Explained
summary: Spotify has announced Lossless listening is available for premium subscribers. Here's what to know about the audio format and how to access it on the music streaming service.
story: Spotify's latest feature will have premium listeners hearing the highest quality audio available on the streaming app.
Spotify announced Lossless listening on Sept. 10, meaning premium users can listen to nearly every song on the app in up to 24-bit/44.1 kHz FLAC.
The high-resolution sound quality will allow listeners to hear tracks in greater detail, the company said in a news release.

“We’ve taken time to build this feature in a way that prioritizes quality, ease of use, and clarity at every step, so you always know what’s happening under the hood,” Spotify’s vice president of subscriptions, Gustav Gyllenhammar, said in the release. “With Lossless, our premium users will now have an even better listening experience.”
Here's what to know about Lossless listening on Spotify, and when the feature will be launching for premium users.
What Is Spotify Lossless?

Lossless audio refers to files that retain all of the original recording information, according to the audio technology company Sonos. "Lossy audio," on the other hand, are files that don't include some of the original audio information.
While all files undergo some form of compression, lossless audio has a high sample rate and a high bit depth that makes it almost indistinguishable from the original recording, according to Sonos.

“Lossless refers to when there’s no change between what you deliver to a streaming service and what the listener hears,” Spotify Studios producer and engineer Jack Mason said in an Instagram post. “Without lossless, track files might get compressed in the encoding process, which might not lend to the best quality.”
Spotify's Lossless listening allows users to play tracks at up to 24-bit/44.1 kHz FLAC, the company said, which refers to a 24-bit depth and 44.1 kHz sample rate.
Other streaming services like Apple Music and Amazon Music also offer lossless audio.
Who Can Access Spotify Lossless Listening?
Lossless listening is available to Spotify users with a premium subscription.

Premium subscribers in Australia, Austria, Czechia, Denmark, Germany, Japan, New Zealand, the Netherlands, Portugal, Sweden, the U.S. and the U.K. have already started to get access, Spotify said in the news release.
The company added that the feature is "rolling out gradually to more than 50 markets through October."
How Do I Enable Spotify Lossless Listening?
Spotify premium subscribers can choose between custom settings to listen with Lossless listening on Wi-Fi, cellular and downloads, the company said.
Options to listen in Low, Normal, High, Very High and now Lossless music quality are available, and users will be able to see how much data each option requires.
According to Spotify, turning on Lossless audio in the Spotify app takes three steps:
Tap your profile icon in the top left.
Go to Settings & Privacy → Media Quality.
Select where you want to enable Lossless audio: Wi-Fi, cellular, downloads.

Lossless listening will be available on mobile, desktop and tablet, as well as on most devices that support Spotify Connect, including Sony, Bose, Samsung, Sennheiser and more, according to Spotify. Support for more devices, including Sonos and Amazon, will be available in October.
The company noted that listeners will need to enable Lossless listening on each individual device, and if enabled, a Lossless indicator will appear in the Now Playing view or bar.
Spotify recommended streaming Lossless music on Wi-Fi while using wired headphones or speakers on a non-Bluetooth connection for the smoothest listening experience.
Bluetooth does not currently have enough bandwidth to transmit lossless audio, so the signal has to be compressed before it is sent, according to Spotify.

Spotify also said users who have enabled Lossless listening may have to wait a moment for the track to play due to the size of the audio files, but once the track is cached and loaded, users will be ready to listen.

title: 'Stranger Things' Star Noah Schnapp Shares What He Would Tell His Younger Self As Series Comes to an End
summary: Noah Schnapp reflects on "Stranger Things" coming to an end, how it felt filming his final scene and what he would tell his younger self.
story: For almost 10 years, Noah Schnapp has been living in the “Stranger Things” universe.

The actor, who portrays Will Byers, was just 11 years old when the hit Netflix series premiered and then took the world by storm. Now with its fifth and final season coming this fall, Schnapp reflects on filming his final scene and what he would tell his younger self.
“I would say, ‘Just be present. Enjoy it all. It goes by so fast,’” the 20-year-old actor told TODAY.com at a Got Milk? 30th anniversary of the Milk Mustache event in Los Angeles.
“Stranger Things” is Schnapp’s breakthrough role, leading him to other projects like “Abe,” Bridges of Spies,” “Waiting for Anya” and more.

Still playing the character into adulthood, Schnapp’s Will has been through a transformative journey in “Stranger Things.” In Season 1, he was captured and taken into the “Upside Down,” the alternate dimension that has taken over Hawkins, Indiana. Ever since, he’s had a torturous link to the supernatural world.

Facing bullies and demons as the seasons continued, it was the fourth season that dug deeper into Will's life. After the episodes streamed, fans speculated that Will was secretly in love with his best friend Mike Wheeler (Finn Wolfhard).
Schnapp told Variety in 2022 that his character’s sexuality was “up to the audience’s interpretation.”
He then, however, added, “Now it’s 100% clear that he is gay and he does love Mike. But before, it was a slow arc.”

Fans have been waiting three years to see what Will and the rest of the “Stranger Things” crew’s destinies are. Dropping in three parts, the first four episodes will premiere on Nov. 26, followed by three more on Dec. 25 and the series finale on Dec. 31.
When asked how it felt to film his final scene as Will, he told TODAY.com, “It was very emotional and definitely hard to say goodbye.”
Adding, “Emotions pouring out of all of us. I’m sure you can imagine.”

Before the “Stranger Things” final press tour kicks off, Schnapp teamed up with Got Milk to celebrate 30 years of the milk mustache ad and its place in pop culture. He also reunited with his “Stranger Things” co-star Priah Ferguson, who portrays Erica Sinclair.
The posed for photos at the event, which highlighted the new campaign. For the first time in the company’s history, the famous mustache was center stage on everyday Californians.

“(The company) just drove up the coast of California and knocked on people’s doors and took pictures of all these different people with the milk mustache,” Schnapp said. “And it’s really focused on the diversity and authenticity.”
The actor also recalled seeing the famous ads when he was a child and is now honored to be part of the reimagined campaign, focusing on community and real people in California.

title: Jillian Harris Asked Her Grandma to Be a Bridesmaid — Then Found a Way to Include Her After Her Death
summary: Jillian Harris honored her late grandmother in a touching way on her wedding day, carrying her ashes and sharing the emotional tribute on Instagram.
story: When former “Bachelorette” and HGTV star Jillian Harris began planning her wedding to husband Justin Pasutto in 2016, she intended for her beloved grandmother to be her maid of honor.
Sadly, Harris’ grandmother died in 2019, the year before the couple originally planned to walk down the aisle. Their nuptials hit another snag when they were postponed in light of the COVID pandemic.

When the two finally tied the knot in August 2025, Harris figured out a touching way to include her grandmother in their ceremony. She carried her ashes in an elegant white urn tucked inside her wedding dress.

Harris shared the story of her emotional wedding-day tribute Sept. 10 in an Instagram video that began with footage of her telling her grandmother over a 2016 video call that Pasutto, a former pro snowboarder, had just popped the question on Christmas Day.
“Now do you want to be pushed down the aisle in your wheelchair or do you want to take your walker down the aisle?” Harris asks.
“Which aisle?” her grandmother responds.
“The wedding aisle,” Harris tells her as her grandmother covers her mouth and cries.
The video then flashes forward to show Harris in her wedding dress last month, flashing the small urn to the camera.
She later takes the urn out again and places it on a table as the couple, who share son Leo, 9, and daughter Annie, 6, dines with their guests.
Later, at their reception, her cousins raise a toast to “Granny,” Harris’ “bridesmaid up in heaven.”
The video goes on to show Harris on the dance floor where she takes the urn from the top of her party dress and gives it a kiss.
Harris captioned the clip, “No way was I walking down the aisle without her.”
Harris’ fans commented to say how much they loved the sweet way she kept her grandmother close to her on her special day.
“My god I am actually sobbing she was there in spirit tapping her feet away all throughout the night,” wrote one.
“This is the best,” someone else added. “Your granny was right there with you the whole time.”

title: Bad Bunny Says ICE Raids Influenced Decision to Host Residency in Puerto Rico
summary: Bad Bunny is opening up about why he chose to base his concert residency in his home country of Puerto Rico, pointing to the current political environment in the United States
story: Bad Bunny is opening up about why he chose to base his concert residency in his home country of Puerto Rico, pointing to the current political environment in the United States.

The 31-year-old rapper and singer launched his 30-show residency, which is currently sold out, at the José Miguel Agrelot Coliseum in San Juan in July. Since then, hundreds of thousands of fans have flown to the island to see the Grammy Award winner perform, including many celebrities.

Before his “No Me Quiero Ir de Aquí” (“I Don’t Want to Leave Here”) shows began, he told Variety that it was “unnecessary” to bring the shows to the United States. Now, during a recent interview with i-D magazine, Bad Bunny expounded on why he chose not to tour in the United States — as well as the significance of playing shows in Puerto Rico.

When asked by the British publication if one of the reasons that the concerts are taking place abroad is because of the “mass deportations of Latinos” across the country, he confirmed that concern impacted his decision.

“Man, honestly, yes,” he replied. “There were many reasons why I didn’t show up in the US, and none of them were out of hate —I’ve performed there many times. All of (the shows) have been successful. All of them have been magnificent. I’ve enjoyed connecting with Latinos who have been living in the US.”

Bad Bunny continued, “But specifically, for a residency here in Puerto Rico, when we are an unincorporated territory of the US… People from the US could come here to see the show. Latinos and Puerto Ricans of the United States could also travel here, or to any part of the world. But there was the issue of — like, f------ ICE could be outside (my concert). And it’s something that we were talking about and very concerned about.”
Since the beginning of the year, there have been ICE raids around the country, leading to protests.
The “Baile Inolvidable” singer also told i-D that he believes fans can better understand his music and the “whole experience” that comes with it when they are in Puerto Rico.

“It feels a bit like… How do I say this? Innocence. An eternal innocence. It has the joy and the party vibe of ‘Un Verano Sin Ti,’ but this time the Puerto Rican-ness is more present than ever,” he said. “The pride, the sense of homeland that unites generations. It’s always been something you see in my concerts, but in this concert, it is much more marked. There are kids who are 17, 18—but also those who are 20, 30, 40, 60, there are elderly people. You see people dancing, laughing, singing.”
Bad Bunny previously discussed how meaningful the tour and his home country is to him when he appeared on Sunday TODAY with Willie Geist Aug. 31.

“This is so far my best experience in music, maybe in life. This happening right now in San Juan in that arena is something magical,” he marveled. His shows have brought in more than $200 million to the island, according to an organization that promotes the island called Discover Puerto Rico.

He further shared the joy he feels performing in Puerto Rico while speaking to Geist. “It’s such a pleasure to show my culture, my country, my land, right there, in my house,” he said. The musician also pointed out the location allows him to sleep in his bed every night, spend time with his family and avoid air travel.
“We show the best of Puerto Rico and also the toughest or delicate things about Puerto Rico,” he added. “I think that’s the beauty of this show. That is very powerful and honest.”

title: EXCLUSIVE: Julie Chrisley Reacts to Son Grayson Saying He's Given Up His Life to TV
summary: Julie Chrisley reacts to son Grayson saying he's given everything to cameras and defended his privacy.
story: Julie Chrisley's life, as well as her children's, was turned upside down after she was sentenced to seven years in prison.

While speaking to TODAY.com, the Chrisley matriarch, who was pardoned and released earlier this year, reflects on how her youngest son, Grayson Chrisley, was affected by her imprisonment and what they want to keep private after being in the public eye for over 10 years.

The Chrisleys are no stranger to reality television. Julie Chrisley, along with husband Todd Chrisley and their combined six children, starred in the USA Network series “Chrisley Knows Best” from 2014 to 2023.

The family's time on screen ended after the parents were convicted on federal fraud charges in 2022. They reported to their respective prisons in 2023, with Julie Chrisley serving an original seven-year sentence, which was later shortened by 14 months. Todd Chrisley's 12-year sentence was changed to 10 years.
After being pardoned by President Donald Trump and released in May 2025, they began filming the Lifetime special “The Chrisleys: Back to Reality.”
In the first episode, Grayson Chrisley talks about leaving baseball behind after his parents went to prison and how he's given up his life to the cameras.
“Baseball was my entire life. That’s what I’ve done every weekend, year-round since I was 5 years old,” the 19-year-old told the camera. “I’ve never played a game that my mom wasn’t at.”

Amid his parents' legal case, he recalled his mom getting out of court to go watch his tournament in Atlanta, adding that when she couldn’t be there to watch him play, he decided, “I don’t really want to play anymore.”
The teen then showed off a stuffed animal bear with a voice recording that his mom left him.
“And now I’m not playing it,” he said. “I don’t want to listen to it. I feel like that’s the last private thing I have.”
When a person off camera asked if playing the message out loud was “too far,” Grayson Chrisley replied, “I mean, we give the cameras everything. That’s one thing I won’t”
Adding, “That’s one thing the cameras don’t get.”
Julie Chrisley tells TODAY.com that she had not seen the scene and had no idea he said that.
“I commend Grayson and I didn’t know that that took place. I didn’t know that he said that,” she says. “And I love that he was able to set those boundaries because that’s very important.”
She continues, “And I’m so glad and so proud of him for that.”
She says it takes “a village” to raise children, commending daughter Savannah Chrisley, who became Grayson Chrisley and her niece Chloe’s legal guardian after Julie and Todd Chrisley entered prison.
The Lifetime special documented Savannah Chrisley’s journey to help her parents be released and the dysfunction the family faced.

“You see the ups and the downs and the chaos and dysfunction that’s going on,” Savannah Chrisley tells TODAY.com. “But for 10 years, we had to live a life that wasn’t necessarily our life. So for this show, whether people like comments I make or don’t like comments I make, I feel at peace knowing I lived in the moment.”
She adds that the biggest thing for her was to be “truly authentic and honest about my journey and my story, and that’s what I did.”
The family continues to share updates on podcasts and social media. But Julie Chrisley notes that there might be some changes when it comes to returning to reality TV.

“I’m sure there are going to be things that I’m going to want to keep private,” Julie Chrisley says. “You have to keep in mind, we weren’t here for the filming of this season. We literally filmed when we came home, and then we filmed a couple of interviews. So that was the extent of us filming.”
Calling it a “completely different” experience than “Chrisley Knows Best,” she says. “There’s going to be some learning curve if there is more filming in the future.”

title: Prince Harry and King Charles Reunite in London For 1st Time in 19 Months
summary: Prince Harry has reunited with his father, King Charles III, for the first time in 19 months
story: Prince Harry has reunited with his father, King Charles III, for the first time in 19 months.
The father-son duo spent time together at his father’s residence, Clarence House, in London on Sept. 10 over a private tea, Buckingham Palace officials confirmed.
Photos of the Duke of Sussex being driven in a black Range Rover to his father’s home surfaced the same day.

Harry returned to the United Kingdom this week on a rare solo trip to reconnect with the charities and organizations he works with. His visit aligns with the third anniversary of the death of his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II.
Harry and his father had not met in person since February 2024, shortly after Charles had been diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer.
Harry discussed the possibility of mending his relationship with the rest of the royal family during a candid interview with the BBC in May 2025.
“I would love reconciliation with my family. There’s no point in continuing to fight. Life is precious. I don’t know how much longer my father has. It would be nice to reconcile,” he said.

The interview came shortly after Harry lost an appeal to get his British security detail restored. Harry lost public funding for his protection after he and his wife, Meghan, Duchess of Sussex,  stepped down as working members of the royal family in 2020 and relocated to the United States. Now, their security in the U.K. is decided on a case-by-case basis.
Harry, who called the ruling a “surprise,” said during the interview that his father “won’t speak to me because of this security stuff.”
“I’m devastated — not so much as devastated with the loss that I am about the people behind the decision, feeling as though this is OK. Is it a win for them?” he told the BBC.
He added that without a higher level of security, he would hesitate to return to the U.K. with Meghan and their two children,Archie, 6, and Lilibet, 4.
“I can’t see a world in which I would be bringing my wife and children back to the U.K. at this point. And the things that they’re going to miss are, well, everything, he said.
“I love my country, I always have done, despite what some people in that country have done ... and I think that it’s really quite sad that I won’t be able to show my children my homeland,” he added.
Harry’s visit comes two weeks after the Season 2 premiere of Meghan’s Netflix lifestyle series, “With Love, Meghan.”

title: Inside Julie and Todd Chrisley's 1st Conversation After Leaving Prison
summary: Todd and Julie Chrisley’s long-awaited reunion plays out in front of cameras in the latest episode of “The Chrisleys: Back to Reality.”
story: Todd and Julie Chrisley’s long-awaited reunion plays out in front of cameras in the latest episode of “The Chrisleys: Back to Reality.”
The Lifetime docuseries, which premiered on Sept. 1, chronicles the couple's legal battles, prison sentences and presidential pardon.
In Episode 6, which aired on Sept. 9, viewers got to watch the couple reunite in person for the first time since they reported to their respective prisons in January 2023.
Below, we're outlining everything you need to know about the couple's first conversation after returning home from prison.
Why Were Todd and Julie Chrisley in Jail?
The reality stars were initially sentenced to a combined 19 years in prison after they were convicted on federal fraud charges. They initially pleaded not guilty.
On Sept. 8, 2023, the Federal Bureau of Prisons shortened their sentences.

The couple's daughter, Savannah Chrisley, advocated for her parents' release from prison after they began serving their time. In May 2025, President Donald Trump agreed to pardon the reality stars. They were released from their respective prisons on May 28.
What Happened When Julie and Todd Chrisley  Reunited?
Episode 6 of “The Chrisleys: Back to Reality” shows footage of Todd and Julie Chrisley leaving their respective prisons.

After being escorted out of the building, Todd Chrisley jumps into a car with his daughter Savannah Chrisley. He acknowledges that his release hasn’t “registered yet” and quickly asks if she’s checked in with her mother yet. The father-daughter duo then receive a call from President Trump.
Todd Chrisley is eager to hear from his wife and says, “I’m just ready to see her.”

Savannah Chrisley then sets up a FaceTime call so her father can see his wife leave prison and embrace their son, Grayson Chrisley, who had gone to pick up his mother. As Todd Chrisley watches the emotional moment, he begins to cry.
Finally face-to-face with Julie Chrisley on the phone, a crying Todd Chrisley says, “I’ve missed you so much I can hardly stand it.”

When Julie Chrisley asks where her husband is, he amuses her with his response: Pizza Hut. After saying they love each other, the couple says goodbye for the time being so they can continue making calls to their other children.

Julie Chrisley arrives home first and embraces her family members. When Todd Chrisley arrives home later in the night, he hugs his children then lays eyes on his wife. They hug and kiss then hold hands while looking at each other.
“Oh my God, you look like your dad,” Julie Chrisley says.
“This seems weird.” he says as he touches his wife’s brown hair. “We gotta get that s--- fixed.”
In a later scene, Julie Chrisley says, “Well, we survived.”
“We have done that. I never thought I’d be with a dark-headed woman, but I’m willing to try it tonight,” Todd Chrisley replies.
“Get away from me,” she jokes.
When a producer asks Todd Chrisley what it was like seeing his wife again, he offers the following response.

“Well, I know that for me, that I have never loved but one woman in my life and that’s Julie. And I know the bond that she and I have and the time was not going to break that bond. But it didn’t mean that it hurt any less,” he says.

The reality star continues, saying, “There were days that I felt like that I would not be able to get through that day and I would go and work out and I would walk and I would pray. And I never felt like I was disconnected from her. I always felt like I was with her every day anyway, cause I kept her in my heart at all times.”

title: ‘Bargain Block’ Stars Say Show Cancellation ‘Derailed’ Their Business
summary: “Bargain Block” stars and couple Keith Bynum and Evan Thomas are speaking out about how their business was “derailed” after they learned that their home renovation show was not returning after five seasons.
story: “Bargain Block” stars and couple Keith Bynum and Evan Thomas are speaking out about how their business was “derailed” after they learned that their home renovation show was not returning after five seasons.

“Bargain Block” premiered on HGTV in 2021 for its first nine-episode season that followed partners Bynum and Thomas as they fixed up properties and turned them into polished houses for first-time homebuyers, according to the network’s website. The series aired for four more seasons, but the forthcoming Season 5 will be its last. Bynum informed fans on Instagram in June that HGTV would not be renewing the show.

“The last six months have been a pretty wild journey,” he wrote beside photos of the couple, including behind-the-scenes snaps of them working on “Bargain Block.” “Our entire business and lives have been put through the ringer at the hands of a giant corporation, yet we persist lol.  Though you may not be seeing us for much longer on HGTV, we’re excited that we’ve built such an amazing base of followers and we’re very excited about the future.”
HGTV has not officially announced that “Bargain Block” has been cancelled. TODAY.com has reached out to the network for a comment about the show’s status.
In a recent interview with People, Bynum and Thomas opened up about how they were told the series was abruptly ending and how it impacted their business, NINE Design + Homes.

The final episode of Season 5, titled “Crumbling in Corktown,” will air on Wednesday, Sept. 10 and double as a series finale, even though it was not intended to be their last renovation, the co-hosts told the publication.
“We do have another house in Detroit that we’re finishing that was gonna actually be on Season 5,” Thomas revealed.
But Thomas said after the cancellation, that project “took a back seat just for revenue purposes.”
The pair also claimed that HGTV initially contacted them in February to tell them about the show not being renewed.

Bynum shared, “Six months ago, our entire business was literally derailed,” adding that the couple’s “revenue stream was built heavily off our television contracts. And we had already been moving in a direction to fulfill a fifth season when it was announced that they were not going to move forward.”
He said the two were not prepared for the career shift. “We just got caught with our pants down. And as a business owner, that’s the worst feeling in the world.”

After hearing the news, Bynum said the couple “had to take aside the personal elements from that business decision and kind of analyze them like we would our own business, and that helped me process a lot of it.”
The update they shared with their fans in June “helped release a lot of the anger that we had felt for months” Bynum said.
Since saying goodbye to “Bargain Block,” the two have shifted their focus to client work and NINE Design + Homes, and it was certainly an adjustment.
“There’s a massive cultural difference between doing television and then going back to client work,” Bynum explained.
Despite the career change, Thomas wants fans to know that the duo are doing OK.

“We’ve gotten a lot of people who are like, ‘Oh, I’m so sorry that this was cancelled,’” Thomas said. “And I just wanna say that things are good (and) our business is good. And if you need a house done, you should email us.”

title: 'The Girlfriend' Ending: Laurie Davidson Unpacks Daniel's 'Messy as Hell' Revelation
summary: What happens to Daniel at the end of The Girlfriend? Do he and Cherry end up together? What does he decide to do? What is the final scene?
story: Warning: This story contains spoilers for “The Girlfriend.”
Daniel (Laurie Davidson) spends most of the new miniseries “The Girlfriend” torn between two women: His protective mom, Laura (Robin Wright), and his new girlfriend, Cherry (Olivia Cooke).

The six-episode series, based on a novel by Michelle Frances, follows the three main players in a dance. Laura is suspicious of Cherry from the start — and, it turns out, with reason. But the lengths she goes to in order to keep Cherry from her son are just as questionable and unforgivable.
In an interview with TODAY.com, Davidson says his character Daniel is “pretty oblivious to what’s going on for a while.”
“I think Daniel probably has a more balanced view of them both. He likes to see the good in both people,” he reflects. “Daniel defends both Laura and Cherry to each other, from each other.”
More on 'The Girlfriend'
What Happens at the End of ‘The Girlfriend’? Robin Wright Unpacks the Surprising Twist
What Happens at the End of ‘The Girlfriend’? Robin Wright Unpacks the Surprising Twist
It’s only in the final episode that Daniel awakens to the life-or-death nature of Laura and Cherry’s rivalry, a moment Davidson describes as when “the penny finally kind of drops.”

By then, Daniel knows his mom’s big secret. She lied to Cherry and said he had died in an attempt to keep them apart. Daniel and Cherry reunite but he’s still open to hearing from his mom. During a rare visit home, Laura makes yet another questionable choice: She drugs Daniel so he has to sit captive and watch an incriminating video about Cherry. Of course, Cherry shows up and the three have a showdown.
Daniel ultimately kills his own mother while trying to save Cherry from drowning.
Waleed Zuaiter, who plays Daniel’s father Harold, likens the moment to a “Greek tragedy”— overwhelming in its scope and consequences.
“It’s like he killed his mom. It’s so overwhelming,” Zuaiter says. The weight of that action will define Daniel’s future, creating what the actor calls “a lot of guilt” and “lessons to be learned.”

Another twist happens in the show’s final scene, set months later. Cherry is now pregnant and it seems the family has re-adjusted to their new reality. Harold is in the background, a decision Zuaiter insisted on.

“I wanted to be in the final silhouette of the show. Originally, I wasn’t in there. And I said, I think it’s very important for Howard to, for the audience to go, OK, he’s still in the picture,” he reveals. “He’s remaining part of this family unit, as flawed as it was.”
Daniel finds his mom’s phone with the video and watches it, learning the truth about his wife, not girlfriend.
Davidson says the “messy as hell” revelation will likely lead to an entirely new crisis of identity for Daniel, who he thinks will become consumed with finding answers.
“Daniel would go looking for some answers from Cherry. You know, he’s killed his mom to protect who he loved,” he says — only to learn more about Cherry, and that his mom was protecting him.
“He’s going to need a lot of therapy,” he says.
Both Davidson and Zuaiter are sympathetic to Laura’s no-win scenario, where intervention pushes loved ones away, but inaction feels like betrayal of parental responsibility.
“It’s her responsibility to act in the best interests that she feels for her family. It’s very difficult not to do that,” Davidson says.
When asked about the appropriate level of family involvement in romantic partnerships, Zuaiter doesn’t hesitate: “You shouldn’t ignore a mother’s instinct.”
Zuiater also thinks the show has a valuable commentary on privilege. Daniel’s family is very wealthy whereas Cherry is trying to transcend her lower class existence.
The show suggests that “real growth happens with change and discomfort,” and the family’s comfortable existence may have actually prevented them from developing healthy coping mechanisms.

The result is what Zuaiter calls “a life and death situation, because they limit their own choices, and they make their own choices about what they’re suppressing, and then it just keeps building and building up.”
The path forward won’t be easy. As Zuaiter puts it: “There’s a lot of skeletons in the closet, and there’s a lot of healing that needs to happen.”
The fear, he says, is that the family will retreat into old patterns and “their avoidance routines, which is kind of what got them here.”

title: New 'Bachelorette' Taylor Frankie Paul Is a Mom of 3
summary: As the new "Bachelorette," Taylor Frankie Paul of "The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives" will be considering which man will make the best father for her children.
story: When Taylor Frankie Paul of Hulu's "The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives" hands out her roses as "The Bachelorette," she won't just be considering which of the contestants she likes the most — she will also be weighing which of the men could make the best father for her children.

Paul, one of the original #MomTok creators, is the mom of three. She shares two children, Indy, 8, and Ocean, 5, with her ex-husband, Tate Paul, and her 1-year-old son, Ever, with her ex-boyfriend, Dakota Mortensen.
When she was offered the lead on the show, Paul told “Call Her Daddy” host Alex Cooper that she had to think long and hard about the filming schedule and its impact on her children before saying yes.
